comments:
build 2002-06-01.

When you have 2 plug-ins with the same ID you get the following message but 
you don't know the location of the other plug-in. (in my case the one which 
was disabled was the good one so I had to search to find out which project had 
the bogus plugin.xml)

!ENTRY org.eclipse.core.runtime 2 1 Jun 01, 2002 11:59:17.249
!MESSAGE Problems encountered loading the plug-in registry.
!SUBENTRY 1 org.eclipse.core.runtime 2 1 Jun 01, 2002 11:59:17.249
!MESSAGE Two plug-ins found with the same id: "org.eclipse.swt". Ignoring 
duplicate at "file:/C:/target/head//plugins/org.eclipse.swt/plugin.xml".

I'm now suffering from this same problem with WSAD.  It is not easy to figure 
out when there are hundreds of plug-ins.  Any suggestions?

This was still an issue. Fixed. The generated output is now:

!ENTRY org.eclipse.update.configurator Apr 12, 2004 23:02:01.931
!MESSAGE Bundle is already installed:
reference:file:/D:/target/releasing/plugins/pluginB/
!STACK 0
org.osgi.framework.BundleException: Bundle "pluginA" version "1.0.0" has already
been installed from: reference:file:D:/target/releasing/plugins/pluginA/
	at
org.eclipse.osgi.framework.internal.core.Framework.installWorkerPrivileged(Framework.java:724)
	at org.eclipse.osgi.framework.internal.core.Framework$1.run(Framework.java:610)
	at java.security.AccessController.doPrivileged(Native Method)
	at
org.eclipse.osgi.framework.internal.core.Framework.installWorker(Framework.java:688)
	at
org.eclipse.osgi.framework.internal.core.Framework.installBundle(Framework.java:605)
	at
org.eclipse.osgi.framework.internal.core.BundleContext.installBundle(BundleContext.java:207)
	at
org.eclipse.update.internal.configurator.ConfigurationActivator.installBundles(ConfigurationActivator.java:180)
...

The entry's message is a little too specific ("Bundle is already installed"). A
bundle can fail to be installed due to other reasons, so a more generic message
would be better (e.g. "Could not install bundle: <location>").

Moving to Update for consideration on changing the message or closing.
I changed the error message as per Rafael's suggestion.

traces.message: Bundle "pluginA" version "1.0.0" has already been installed from: reference:file:D:/target/releasing/plugins/pluginA/
